name: Glass fiber, reinforced polymer; fine ground; from wind turbine; at site
description: This gate-to-gate unit process is for the production of 1 kg fine ground glass fiber from deconstructed wind turbines. The modeled system is only representative of electricity inputs inputs required to produce the fine ground carbon fiber. Exchanges associated with production capital are not modeled. Production inventory data were developed through literature review. The end of life fate for this dataset is landfilling.
category: 56: Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services/5621: Waste Collection

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The inventory is representative of reclaimed, finely ground glass fiber production in 2019.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is representative of recovered finely ground glass fiber production under US conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The inventory is representative of technological conditions for the manufacturing of recovered finely ground glass fiber.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: An attributional LCI method was used to develop the dataset.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: This process was adapted from inventory data developed by Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study.



TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE FLOWS: 
It is unknown whether a cutoff for technosphere flows was used in the original study. Missing technosphere flows are unknown.



MASS BALANCE: 
The mass imbalance for this unit process is unknown.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data for the production of recovered finely ground glass fiber were collected and adapted from collected literature.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Source inventory data were allocated to the production of 1 kg recovered finely ground glass fiber.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were collected from literature sources.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Situation C2 - Accounting (no external benefits): The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.‚Äù The studies categorized under Goal Situation C2 do NOT consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: Data were collected by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
